title: [K-12] Science of Implementing Social Policies for Cancer Prevention and Management: Project-Based Learning Linked Civic Health Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of public health and pedagogy, familiarity with basic concepts for analyzing social systems, and basic awareness of civic and health rights
context.additional_context: Conducted in a BYOD environment, this program focuses on implementing community-based cancer prevention and management strategies through an interdisciplinary approach considering geographical, economic, and cultural factors. Emphasizes civic rights and health rights education, enhancing understanding of community participation and policy decision-making processes.

learning_goals: Learners will systematically analyze the latest policy trends in cancer prevention and management within socio-historical contexts using literature review methodologies and derive institutional improvement plans for health rights assurance

Learners will evaluate the effectiveness of multi-component implementation strategies through case analysis and project-based learning and propose citizen-participatory education plans reflecting local cultural and economic characteristics

Learners will develop cost-effectiveness analysis and resource management-integrated cancer prevention public policy simulation models and explore institutional/policy measures for health equity enhancement
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
